item.title: (Q&A) Data representation
item.description: See also: Data representation Represent +24 in 6-bit sign-and-magnitude § 0 1 1 0 0 0 + 16 8 4 2 1 Represent +24 in 6-bit one’s complement § 0 1 1 0 0 0 + 16 8 4 2 1 Represent +24 in 6-bit two’s complement § 0 1 1 0 0 0 + 16 8 4 2 1 Represent −30 in 8-bit sign-and-magnitude § 1 0 0 1 1 1 1 0 - 64 32 16 8 4 2 1 Represent −30 in 8-bit one’s complement § 0 0 0 1 1 1 1 0 1 1 1 0 0 0 0 1 - 64 32 16 8 4 2 1 Represent −30 in 8-bit two’s complement § 0 0 0 1 1 1 1 0 1 1 1 0 0 0 1 0 - 64 32 16 8 4 2 1 Compute the range for 10-bit sign-and-magnitude § −(2n−1)+1,2n−1−1 −(29)+1,29−1 −511,+511 Compute the range for 10-bit one’s complement § −(2n−1)+1,2n−1−1 −(29)+1,29−1 −511,+511 Compute the range for 10-bit two’s complement § −(2n−1),2n−1−1 −(29),29−1 −512,+511 What is the normalized form for IEEE SP? § ±1.

item.title: Application software
item.description: Applications § An application, or app, sometimes called application software, consists of programs designed to make users more productive, conduct business, or provide entertainment.

item.title: Boolean, logic gates, and bitwise operations
item.description: See also: Data representation Logic operations § OperationInputSymbolOutputBufferAANOTAAˉANDA,BABORA,BA+BNANDA,BABˉXORA,BAˉB+ABˉ Logic operations based on Boolean algebra may be used on Boolean data to produce a result of either true (1) or false (0).

item.title: Character representation
item.description: Character representation § Character data cannot be represented directly in a computer because computers process only bits; such data is represented indirectly by defining a table that assigns a numeric value to each character.

item.title: Data representation
item.description: Computer systems represent data electrically and process it with electrical switches with 2 states (on / off) that express binary data. Computers deal with all sorts of non-numeric data (e.

item.title: Floating-point representation
item.description: See also: Data representation IEEE Single Precision § Normalized form: ±1.M×2E′−127 Represent the number in binary -6.0625d = -110.0001b Get the normalized form: ±1.

item.title: Integer representation
item.description: See also: Data representation Sign and magnitude § Leftmost bit is used as a sign bit, i.e., 1 if negative and 0 if positive Fixed number of bits n; values range from −(2n−1)+1 to 2n−1−1 ___ ___ ___ ___ ___ ___ ___ ___ .

item.title: Internetworking
item.description: Computer networks § A computer network refers to the connection of two or more computers through software and hardware, facilitating communication between them.

item.title: Introduction to number systems
item.description: Computers process data into information and work exclusively with numbers. All data is represented in binary form, which represents data in combinations of 1’s and 0’s.

item.title: Memory components
item.description: Internal memory § Also known as primary memory; refers to memory that stores small amounts of data that can be accessed quickly while the computer is running.
